block.para: Shows how to use the &Python3long; in a Jupyter notebook to detect entities in text that is extracted from an image. This example uses &TEXTRACTlong; to extract text from an image stored in &S3long; (&S3;) and &CMPlong; to detect entities in the extracted text.

This example is a Jupyter notebook and must be run in an environment that can host notebooks. For instructions on how to run the example using &SMlong;, see the directions in TextractAndComprehendNotebook.ipynb.
For complete source code and instructions on how to set up and run, see the full example on GitHub.
